title: OPERATIONS MANAGER (DHS)
description:
Founded in 1981, **Diaspora Community Services (DCS)** is a Brooklyn-based multi-service and multi-cultural 501 (c) 3 nonprofit providing comprehensive supports to low income residents, immigrants, and the chronically ill. DCS serves some 10,000 annually through three programmatic sites in New York City. Staffed by seasoned professionals in the health and social service sectors and supported by a dedicated Board of Directors as diverse as the vibrant communities we serve, DCS provides robust programming that targets the most vulnerable of our communities.

DCS’s programs address the very root causes of the challenges our clients face, empowering low income families and individuals to overcome obstacles to their well-being and self-sufficiency. DCS continues to focus on the challenges and inequities that impact communities of color, women and the youth of our communities. Using an anti-racist, gender, sexual orientation affirming lens, DCS has focused on ensuring clients have access to much needed benefits, counseling, education, housing placement and referrals to many qualified organizational partners. DCS has implemented youth programs based on youth development principles of education, empowerment and focusing on the assets of our youth instead of deficits. We are known for our expertise on HIV prevention at the community based level.

Current program services include access to quality health services, supportive housing, youth education, and the social support services critical to meeting basic needs while focusing on impacting poverty. DCS meets each client where they are in terms of individual skills, finances, health and needs; providing one-on-one transformative support to help them succeed.

title: Backup Administrator - Veritas NetBackup
description:

* Expertise in NetBackup Access V8 with Virtual File Replicator (VFR).
* Proficient in managing NetBackup 5340 appliance with AIR replication.
* Optional but preferred experience with using S3 protocol for communication with PURE as a replication target for immutable backup images.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Detail-oriented with a focus on ensuring data security and compliance.

title: Local Director - Child Evangelism Fellowship
description:
Local Director - Child Evangelism Fellowship  

  

**Local Director for North Jersey**

The Local Director of the North Jersey Chapter of CEF of New Jersey Inc. will be responsible for fulfilling the purpose of Child Evangelism Fellowship Inc., executing the vision of the New Jersey state board and USA Ministries while overseeing all aspects of the local chapter. The North Jersey Chapter includes Bergen, Essex, Passaic, Morris, Sussex, and Warren Counties.


**Ministry**

The local director must:


* Understand the foundation of ministry is prayer. Lead by example, in being committed to developing, implementing, improving and growing an effective local prayer program.
* Diligently pursue church partnerships to fulfill the purpose of CEF: evangelize, disciple and establish the next generation to God and His church.
* Be able to identify, recruit, and disciple others to become an effective team serving God in this ministry.
* Be involved in a minimum level of direct ministry with children to maintain an understanding of today’s child and to adequately evaluate the effectiveness of CEF programs.
* Be able to identify students (grades 9 – college) who may be potential Christian Youth in Action® candidates, personally participate in CYIA as assigned by state leadership, and help CYIA become/remain successful.
* Establish, develop, and enhance ministry effectiveness throughout the chapter.

**Leadership**

The local director will:


* Work with the local committee in providing vision and strategic plans for evangelizing and discipling all children within the chapter, striving to establish with local churches.
* Meet regularly with and lead ministry staff and volunteers to provide encouragement, counsel, and direction.
* Assist ministry staff and volunteers in developing and evaluating the ministry goals.
* Encourage the local committee to take advantage of committee training opportunities.
* Work with the local committee in raising sufficient funds for the ministry.
* Annually assess all ministry staff.
* Recognize and develop leadership skills in ministry staff, volunteers, and summer missionaries.
* Oversee and constantly evaluate the teacher training program.

**Administrative**

The local director will:


* Ensure that all CEF policies and procedures are followed and proper governance is maintained.
* Keep accurate and complete records.
* Work with the local committee to develop and submit an annual budget to the state director for state board approval annually.
* Ensure that all reports, minutes, communications, money, and donor receipts are submitted as required.
* Communicate accurately about the chapter condition to the state director and local committee.
* Attend all state-office-sponsored meetings as requested by the state director or board.

**Qualifications**

CEF of North Jersey is seeking a committed servant of God who walks daily with Him, has assurance of salvation, is in agreement with CEF’s Statement of Faith, and will abide by the Worker’s Compliance Agreement. The candidate must believe God has called the applicant to this ministry. The applicant will be a student of God’s Word, dependent on prayer, active in a local church, and have a good testimony. The prescribed requirements for this position are as follows:


* Possess leadership qualities as found in 1 Timothy 3 and Titus 1.
* Have a demonstrated love for Jesus Christ and prayer, and an unquestionable passion to reach kids with the Gospel.
* Be a continual learner, relevant, strategist, love people, and demonstrate an understanding of how to lead and build a team that is diverse in skills, experience and culture.
* Love the local church and other Christian organizations and value them as ministry partners.
* Have skills to identify other leaders, organize groups, cast vision, and evaluate ministry programs.
* Have excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills.
* Possess basic computer and technology skills and good organizational habits.
* Have completed one year of formal Bible college training.
* Successfully complete Children’s Ministries Institute (12 weeks) in the first two years of service. It is preferred that CMI be completed at one time in the first year of placement. At least a portion of this training must be completed at CEF’s headquarters in Missouri.
* Live in or be willing to relocate to the North Jersey area.

**Comments**

CEF wants to know why the applicant is interested in the position and why the applicant thinks the applicant would be a good fit for it. Address those points in the posting that are the particular strengths and include any relevant volunteer experience.

description:

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 7th largest financial group in the world. Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.


The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites four days per week and work remotely one day. A member of our recruitment team will provide more details.***Job Summary:***


Reports to the Credit Risk Quality Assurance, Director. Monitoring includes transaction and portfolio level activity under the jurisdiction of Corporate Banking Credit (CDA) and Structured Finance Credit Office (SFCO) and booked in the Americas. Business areas include but are not limited to Corporate Banking, Investment Banking, Financial Institutions, Commercial Real Estate, Japanese Corporate Banking, Global Subsidiary Banking, Canada, and Latin America. Credit actions reviewed will span all industries and customer verticals, ranging from large corporate client to middle market and direct lending borrowers.


This director is responsible for ensuring a dynamic and risk-focused approach to the team’s activity, including making improvements to methodology and process efficiency when appropriate and ensuring the effectiveness and accuracy of the results. The director is responsible for communicating with stakeholders, ensuring required governance materials are completed accurately and on time, and overseeing a team of professionals to ensure they have the appropriate skills to undertake all required assessments and are doing so in a consistent, timely and complete manner.


The director will act in both an advisory and effective challenge role with First and Second Line of Defense stakeholders in the context of assessments. Results will be discussed with practitioners to ensure complete understanding and awareness of findings. S/he will also be responsible for reporting/communications with governance bodies including the Credit Risk Committee, the Americas Risk Committee, and the Risk Committee of the Board. In addition, the director will also lead all regulatory interface.


Assessment areas include but are not limited to:

* **TTM rapid rating deterioration** (Pass to non-Pass)
	+ Identification of trends such as those related to Leveraged borrowers and Weakly Underwritten loans within Leveraged borrowers
	+ Compare this population with standards, procedures, and underwriting guideline exceptions and rating model result overrides
	+ Stratification by business group and practitioner
* **Regulatory rating assessment/conclusions**
	+ Including financial analysis, projections, performance to plan, enterprise valuation
	+ Other factors per updated *Assignment of U.S. Regulatory Ratings*, ACRP-500-2
	+ Rating triggers
	+ Rating justifications
* **Internal rating (e.g., Borrower Rating/Asset Securitization Rating) assessment/conclusions**
	+ Including financial analysis, projections, performance to plan, enterprise valuation
	+ Other factors per global Procedures for Credit Ratings; local *Procedures for Credit Ratings*, ACRP-500-8; and other standards, procedures, and/or guidance applicable.
	+ Rating triggers
	+ Rating justifications
* **Timeliness of Reviews**
	+ Internal and regulatory rating assessments completed consistent with procedural requirements under *Rating Frequency and Approval: Corporate Banking, Investment Banking and Markets*, ACRP-500-1
	+ Extensions, if any, reasonable?
	+ Off-cycle reviews completed if/as needed?
* **Internal vs. Regulatory Ratings**
	+ Assessment of anomalous internal vs. regulatory ratings (currently per *Approval Authorities for Pass and Special Mention Credits*, ACRP-600-4; move guidance to *Post-Approval Process / Reviews* which will cover QA)
		- For example, BR-8-2 / Pass due to a fully cash-secured facility
* **Regulatory Leverage Assessment**
	+ Pursuant to *Interagency Guidance on Leveraged Lending*, ACRP-300-5
	+ Weak Underwriting identification for borrower subject to assessment under applicable procedures
* **SLoD Effective Challenge** (evidence/quality)
	+ Applicable to all elements of a credit application but particularly those noted above
* **Appropriate Exercise of Delegated Approval Authority**
	+ Correct approver given transaction characteristics
* **Standards, Procedures, and MAUG Exceptions**
	+ Correct assessment and conclusions given transaction characteristics
	+ Correct MAUG selection
* **Application Content Completeness**
	+ All required attachments included and properly completed?
	+ All required system (e.g., GCARS) fields properly completed?
* **Ad Hoc**
	+ E.g., to determine the appropriateness of the application of standards, procedures, or processes as part of issue remediation efforts or following release of new guidance
	+ In response to changing business strategies, economic environment, market movements, etc.
	+ As recommended by QA team, senior management, or CRC
* **Lessons Learned and Training**
	+ Coordinate with Credit Training, Americas Credit Review, Special Assets Department, and practitioners to facilitate continuous improvement


Other Areas of Responsibility:

**Projects/Issues** – serve as lead or member of a team to pursue projects or issue remediation assigned to the CARM, Credit Planning and Credit Standards team.


Additional Information, Experience and Qualifications:


An MBA or similar degree is preferred plus 15+ years significant corporate/commercial lending experience.


Strong leadership and presentation skills, including 7 years in a management position.


Extensive experience in credit risk, risk rating (internal and regulatory), credit standards and procedures application, credit/financial statement analysis, all based on a solid understanding of business and financial markets and the effects of economic conditions on the Bank’s risk assets, as well a diverse knowledge of a broad range of industry fundamentals, financial products, and financing structures.


Ability to analyze portfolio trends, identifying signs of changing risk levels and/or symptoms of process control breakdowns.


Ability to initiate and implement continuous improvement of processes related to areas assessed.


Effective communication skills, both oral and written.


Ability to interact effectively with unit managers, lending officers, credit administrators and all levels of First, Second, and Third Line management.

You will work in an environment where the highest professional and ethical standards are maintained as well as full compliance with all Federal, State and Local laws and regulations. Pharmacy Technicians take important steps to ensure all medication needs and regulatory compliance standards are met for our patients and they demonstrate ethical conduct and maintain patient confidentiality at all times.  

  

Success for incumbents in this role includes being able to manage all assigned pharmacy workstations and tasks to support the team’s ability to promptly, safely and accurately fill patient prescriptions all while providing caring service that exceeds customer expectations. Your Pharmacy Technician duties will be restricted by your manager at first until you complete all necessary requirements. Once you satisfy all requirements and expand your Pharmacy Technician duties, you have the opportunity to continue to build your clinical, technical and insurance knowledge and expertise by leveraging available tools and training to build your pharmacy career.

description:

Blue World Construction has specialized in civil construction projects for over a decade, including work on major remediation sites, site grading and preparation, expansion of industrial processing plants and pumping systems, and installation of thousands of feet of pipeline. Our offices in Arizona, Texas, and New Jersey rely on our skilled, highly motivated personnel to deliver success on complex and large-scale assignments and have been recognized for the outstanding quality of our work. The position will be responsible for managing heavy site/civil, process systems, remediation, and/or water treatment /wastewater construction, including project estimating, project set-up, daily project management, and project closeout.


*The compensation for this position is commensurate with experience applicable to the types of projects we work on.*

* Position is based out of Glendale, AZ, and will support projects in AZ and surrounding states. From time-to-time support to our other offices in TX and NJ will be required. Travel work in the field as well as work in the office is required. This is not a flexible/work from home position because of the importance of interaction with the senior team members as well as field teams.
* Valid driver's license – required and in good standing.
* Willingness to be in the field and apply “hands on” learning experience from previous employment and ability to learn new skills.
* Must provide references verifying experience.


**Blue World prides itself on its Drug Free work environment. All employees are subject to an employee drug test, random drug testing, and an employment and annual physical.**


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Position requires very motivated individual that is not afraid to do field work and learn with their hands rather than watching/oversight.
* Position requires entrepreneurial spirit and strong work ethic as well as very good communication/listening skills and teamwork.
* Position requires field time and office time.
* Will work directly for Senior team members in AZ as well as TX and NJ when in the office to provide support on project estimating, project set-up, project management, and project closeout
* Will manage individual projects and work directly with client and superintendents.
* Excellent writing skills are necessary for this position. Technical writing samples must be provided during the interview process for assessment.
* Other responsibilities include preparation of submittals, schedules, project bids, project estimates, daily logs, procurement, subcontractor management, support to project superintendents.
* Goal for this position is grow into a solid project managerial role that is both technically competent and understands the trials/tribulations of construction/field work.
* Travel is required to surrounding states.


**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:**


* Required bachelor's degree in engineering, preferably civil or mechanical, or Construction Management; other bachelor's degrees may be considered if the candidate has the required construction experience.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in preferably civil or mechanical projects and field experience is required. Experience will be verified.
* Any experience with Operation & Maintenance (O&M) of remediation, wastewater or process systems would separate the candidate from others being considered.
* Any AZ wastewater operator license or other license such as Professional Engineer (PE), while not necessary, is something we consider a ‘differentiator' when evaluating candidates.

* Office schedule 8am – 5pm, Monday thru Friday; Field schedule 7am – 4pm, Monday thru Friday

* Health Insurance
